paper.title: Is the Halting problem effectively solvable non-algorithmically, and is the Gödel sentence in NP, but not in P?

chunks.label: Abstract & headline claims
covers: Claims about halting problem solvable non-algorithmically; Gödel predicate in NP not P

chunks.label: Background theses
covers: Church/Turing thesis discussion; proposed 'Provability Thesis' framing

chunks.label: Main argument structure
covers: Implications drawn from the thesis; computability consequences

chunks.label: Complexity-class assertions
covers: Arguments placing Gödel predicate in NP but not P; links to thesis assumptions

chunks.label: Corollaries & conclusion
covers: Corollaries about halting and Turing thesis; summary
